utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So, I'll get candles and my mom's lace tablecloth, and since it's Rachel's birthday, I mean, we want it to be special, I thought I'd poach a salmon.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Ohhh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Question. Why do we always have to have parties where you poach things?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You wanna be in charge of the food committee?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Question two. Why do we always have to have parties with committees?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Really. Why can't we just get some pizzas and get some beers and have fun?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yeah, I agree. Ya know, I think fancy parties are only fun if you're fancy on the inside and I'm just not sure we are.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright. If you guys don't want it to be special, fine. You can throw any kind of party you want.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Joey they're not real. I start miles beneath the surface of these things, ok, they're fake. See honk honk.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Wow, it's, it's like porno for clowns.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I talked to Rachel's sisters, neither of them can come.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, um so, I still have to invite Dillon and Emma and Shannon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah, uh, no Shannon Cooper.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Why not her?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Cause she uh, she steals stuff.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Or maybe she doesn't steal stuff and Joey just slept with her and never called her back.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Joey that is horriable.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey I liked her, alright. Maybe, maybe too much. I don't know I guess I just got scared.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I didn't know.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I didn't think anyone'd buy that, ok.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi honey, how did it go?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Agh, it was the graduation from hell.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ya know, my cousin went to hell on a football scholarship.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ya know, I mean this is supposed to be a joyous occasion. My sister's graduating from college, nobody thought she would. It's a true testament to what a girl from long island would do for a Celica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So what happened?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: My parents happened. All they had to do was sit in the same stadium, smile proudly, and not talk about the divorce. But nooo, they got into a huge fight in the middle of the commencement address. Bishop Tutu actually had to stop and shush them. But you know what, you know what the good news is? I get to serve coffee for the next 8 hours.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, so I guess we don't invite her parents.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, how bout just her mom?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Why her mom?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Cause I already invited her.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, did you ask Stacy Roth?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh no, can't invite her. She also steals.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, here are the birthday candles. Where's the birthday cake?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, we're not having birthday cake, we're having birthday flan.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's a traditional Mexican custard dessert.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Oh that's nice. Happy birthday Rachel, here's some goo.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Dr. Greene. Oh my God it's Rachel's dad. What're you doing here?

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: What? The father can't drop by to see the daughter on her birthday?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No no, the father can, but um, since I am the roommate I can tell you that she's not here and I'll pass along the message, ok. So bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Ohhh, you're having a parteee.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No, no, not a party. Just a surprise gathering of some people Rachel knows. Um, this is Phoebe and Chandler and Joey.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: I'll never remember all of that. So uh, what's the deal? Rachel comes home, people pop out and yell stuff, is that it?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: This isn't your first surprise party, is it sir?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Hi Monica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Chinese menu guy. Forgot the menus.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, basically just a Chinese guy.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, hey, Dr. Greene, why don't you come with me, we'll put your jacket on Rachel's bed.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Alright, that sounds like a two person job.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Well, my goodness, what was that?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Sandra, I am so sorry, I thought you were Rachel and we just weren't ready for you yet.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: You thought I was Rachel?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes because uh, you look so young.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: And because you're both, you know, white women.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Oh, I missed you kids. Well, should I put my coat in the bedroom?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: NO! No, I'll take that for ya.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Oh well thank you. Such a gentleman. Thank you. Ahh, it all looks so nice, so festive, all the balloons... The funniest thing happened to me on the way here. I was...

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ha-ha, that's great, ha-ha. I can't wait to hear the rest of it, ya know, but I really have to go to the bathroom so... Hey, come with me. Yeah, yeah, it'll be like we're gal pals, ya know, like at a restraunt. Oh, it'll be fun, c'mon.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, think, what would Jack and Chrissy do?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ok, now that your coat is safely in the bedr-, oh, ok we can come back out in the living room.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: So uh, Joey and Chanlder, I, I think it's time that you take Dr. Greene over to your place.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uhh, yes, absdolutely, um. Why again?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Because that's where the party is you goon. See this is just the staging area.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Right this is staging.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah, this more than anything else, is the staging area.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: This is clearly in the wrong apartment.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Alright you guys are off to party number one and you, you are off to party number two Alright fellas, let's keep it movin', let' keep it movin.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Chandler could you at least send some women to my party? Alright that's Ross.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ohh, thank you for the wonderful dinner.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Thanks for being born.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ohh, thank you for my beautiul earrings, they're perfect. I love you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, now you can exchange them if you want, ok.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Now I love you even more.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Surprise.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh my gosh, wow. Monica. Oh my god. Mom. This is so great.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Happy birthday sweetie.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wow you, you. I had no idea.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: No, I knew.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, everybody, there's food and drinks on the table. Go across the hall.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Right now, Joey and Chandler's, go now.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Why.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Just go.

utterance.speaker: ALL
utterance.content: Surprise.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Happy birthday sweetpea.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Daddy.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Both of them are here, both of them, both of them are here?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, we could count again.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I can't believe this is happening.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You know what, this is ridiculous, ok. This is your birthday, this is your party. I say we just put 'em all together and if they can't deal with it, who cares.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: I do.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: That's who.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Look, are you gonna be ok?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, I have to be, I don't really have a choice, I mean, you know, I could look at the bright side, I get two birthday parties and two birthday cakes.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, actually just one birthday flan.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: It's a traditional Mexican custard dessert...Look talk to Monica, she's on the food committee.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Joey, Joey. Hey, some girl just walked up to me and said, 'I want you Dennis,' and stuck her tounge down my throat. I love this party.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Quick volleyball question.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Volleyball.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Yeah, we set up a court in your room. Uh, you didn't really like that grey lamp, did you?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Joey, a woman just stuck her tounge down my throat, I'm not even listening to you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, that's me.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Listen honey, can you keep dad occupied, I'm gonna go talk to mom for a while.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ok, do you have any ideas for any openers?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uhh, let's just stay clear of 'I'm the guy that's doing you daughter' and you should be ok.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok people, I want you to take a piece of paper, here you go, and write down your most embarassing memory. Oh, and I do ask that when you're not using the markers, you put the caps back on them because they will dry out.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi Dr. Greene. So, uh, how's everything in the uh, vascular surgery....game?

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: It's not a game Ross, a woman died on my table today.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm sorry. See that's the good thing about my job. All the dinosaurs on my table are already dead.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Listen you guys, I don't mean to be a pain about this but, um, I've noticed that some of you are just placing them on. You wanna push the caps until you hear them click. Gunther, where're you going?

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: I um, was sorta thinking about maybe...

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No. No you can't go. No this is fun. Come on we're just getting started. Here, here's your marker.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Listen if you wanna go, just go.

utterance.speaker: GUNTER
utterance.content: No, she'll yell at me again.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright, I can get you out.

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Shh. In a minute, I'm gonna create a diversion. When I do, walk quickly to the door and don't look back.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: I think I need a drink.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, here, I, I'll get it for ya. Whad'ya want?

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Scotch.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Scotch. Alright, I'll be back in 10 seconds with your scotch on the rocks in a glass.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Neat.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: No no no, no no no, neat, as in no rocks.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Oh hello Ross, where have you been?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hi. Uh, I have been in the bathroom. Stay clear of the salmon mousse.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Oh, scotch neat. Ya know, that's Rachel's father's drink.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, mine too. Isn't that neat, scotch neat. Would you excuse me? Hey, hey, where you uh, sneakin off to mister?

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: I'm getting my cigarettes out of my jacket.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No. no.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Whad'ya mean no?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, um, see 'cause that, that is, that is the staging area. If you go in there, it'll ruin the whole illusion of the party. Yeah, I think you take your scotch back in there and I will get your cigarettes for you sir.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Get my glasses too.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: All righty roo. What a great moment to say that for the first time.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, the first person's most embarassing memory is, 'Monica, your party sucks.' Very funny.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh no, ooh, ooh, did somebody forget to use a coaster?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: What? I don't see anything.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Great, I'm seeing water rings again.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GELLER
utterance.content: Ross, whose glasses are those?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Mine.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: You wear bi-focals?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Um-hmm. I have a condition, apparently, that I require two different sets of focals.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Did you know my husband has glasses just like that?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well those are very popular frames.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Neil Sedaka wears them.

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: I hear you can get people out of here.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Rachel, you didn't tell me your boyfriend smoked.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, like a chimney.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Ohh, big smoker. Big big smoker. In fact I'm gonna go ou into the hallway and fire up this bad boy.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Are you wearing my glasses?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yes. I was just warming up the earpieces for you.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Thank you. Is that one of my cigarettes?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah, yes it is, I was just moistening the tip.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, ok, she's taking the trash out so I can get you out of here but it has to be now, she'll be back any minute.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No, only the three of you, any more than that and she'll get suspicious.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: There isn't time. You must leave everything. They'll take care of you next door.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Everything you've heard is true.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Could you guys please try to keep it down, we're trying to start a Boggle tournament.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You, and you, you're supposed to be at my party. And Gunther! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: GUNTHER
utterance.content: Um

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, welcome to the fu-oh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Alright, I'm sorry but these people needed me. They work hard all week, it's Saturday night, they deserve to have a little fun. Go.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ya know, my party is fun. I mean, maybe it's a little quieter, less obvious sorta fun but, you know, if people would just give it a chance...

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: You want me to see a therapist?

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Sweetheart, you obviously have a problem. You've chosen a boyfriend exactly like your father.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok mom, you know what, fine, I'll make an appointment ok, but you know what, right now, I gotta go, I gotta go do a thing.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: Did you know your mother spent $1200 dollars on bansai trees. I felt like Gulliver around that place.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Daddy, daddy, you know what, I really wanna hear more about this, I really do, but I just have, I just have to do a, some stuff.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: You work and you work and you work at a marriage but all he cares about is his stupid boat.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: You work and you work and you work on a boat...

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: He always ridiculed my pottery classs...

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: ...and you sand it and you varnish it...

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: ...but when all is said and done, he still drinks out of the mugs.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: ...and her yoga and her Bridges of Madison County...

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: ...the scotch and the cigarettes...

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: ...and the bansai's and the chiuaua...

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: ...I may have only been in therapy for three weeks now dear but...

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: ...what the hell does she want with half a boat...

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: This is it, isn't it? I mean, this is what my life is gonna be like. My mom there, my dad there. Thanksgiving, Christmas. She gets the house, he's in some condo my sister's gonna decorate with wicker. Oh, Chandler how did you get through this?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, I relied on a carefully regimented program of denial and, and wetting the bed.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ya know, I just, so weird. I mean I was in there just listening to them bitch about each other and all I kept thinking about was the fourth of July.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Becasue it reminded you of the way our forefathers used to bitch at each other?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: It's just this thing. Every year we would go out on my dad's boat and watch the fireworks. Mom always hated it because the ocean air made her hair all big. My sister Jill would be throwing up over the side and my dad would be upset becasue nobody was helping and then when we did help he would scream at us for doing it wrong. But then when the fireworks started, everybody just shut up, you know, and it'd get really cold, and we would all just sort of smush under this one blanket. It never occured to anybody to bring another one. And now it's just...

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I, I know.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, thanks for coming, I hope you guys had fun.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Alright, Monica dear, I'm gonna hit the road. Now I've left my 10 verbs on the table. And you be sure and send me that finished poem.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok will do. So glad you came.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: I think I saw Rachel out in the hall.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, let me go check. Your mom want's to say goodbye.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh ok.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Happy birthday sweetie.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ahh, you drive safe.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Ross, what're you doing.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm getting ready for the water skiing. How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well, uh, Dr. Greene, where are you going?

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: To get my coat.

utterance.speaker: GUYS
utterance.content: No no no.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Sorry, we're on a major flan high.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh no, you're not supposed to be here. This is the staging area, you should, it's all wrong, you should leave, ya know, get out. Or perhaps you'd like a creme d'menthe.

utterance.speaker: MR. GREENE
utterance.content: I have to be heading to my chateau, thank you.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh all right, then I guess we're going back into the hallway.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Thanks for coming Mrs. Greene. Well, ok, you take care.

utterance.speaker: MRS. GREENE
utterance.content: Oh, you kids Well, this is the best party I've been to in years.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok everybody, it's time for flan.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yup, get ready for the gelatenous fun.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Kinda looks like that stuff you get when you get a bad infection.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, that's enough.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok Rachel, make a special flan wish.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, I've got one. Wow, those things almost never come true.
